question: My mom is 58 years old with multiple medical problems stemming from severe diabetes.  She has been a diagnosed diabetic for about 25 years.  Over the past 7 years, her diabetes has gotten progressively worse.  She is now a double amputee with minimal kidney and liver function (among many other problems) who frequently (about 1-2 times/month) slips into diabetic shock.  After spending the past 3 months and 3 operations in hospitals, rehabs and nursing homes, she has just recently been diagnosed with a staph infection, pneumonia and now Congestive Heart Failure.  She is currently in the hospital on IV therapy for the staph infection.  The doctors now want to send her back to a nursing home for further rehab.  To me, her outlook seems very grim, but the doctors aren't saying anything.  I'm wondering if we should be pushing for something further?
title: New dianosis of Congestive Heart Failure
